column4: I've been using Ubnto for 2 years now and still don't know my way out of a minor annoyance I keep running into.  If I forgot to put & at the end of a command, is there any keystroke to get the same effect after the fact?  (So I can close the terminal without killing the program I've launched, perhaps)
Thanks, astro76, I knew it had a simple fix.  I knew CTRL-Z and fg to bring back, but didn't know bg.
Now here's a real mind bender.  Anyone tried messing around with Quicken in crossover?  I'm trying to find a way to trick pocket quicken into working.
it installed 2004 with no problems when I tried it
